vehicle

Class RegularManualTransmission

  • java.lang.Object
    • vehicle.RegularManualTransmission
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ManualTransmission

    public class RegularManualTransmission
extends java.lang.Object
implements ManualTransmission
    Implements ManualTransmission Interface which provides general manual transmission operations required for driving a car.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ManualTransmission decreaseGear()
      Decreases gear only when the value is greater than minimum gear value and the current speed is allowed to be in the previous gear range.
      ManualTransmission decreaseSpeed()
      This method decreases the speed of the vehicle if and only if the new speed is within the range of minimum allowable speed for the current gear x(less than or equal to lx or greater than or equal to hx).

    • Constructor Detail

      • RegularManualTransmission

        public RegularManualTransmission(int l1,
                                 int h1,
                                 int l2,
                                 int h2,
                                 int l3,
                                 int h3,
                                 int l4,
                                 int h4,
                                 int l5,
                                 int h5)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructor for RegularManualTransmission class. It sets up the initial transmission object with the speed of value 0, gear of value 1, and status of value - "OK. everything is OK.". It also accepts speed ranges (l1,h1,l2,h2..,l5,h5) defined by low and high for the set of 5 gears and initializes gears for this implementation. If the argument is unacceptable, it throws IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        l1 - lowest speed limit for gear 1.
        h1 - highest speed limit for gear 1.
        l2 - lowest speed limit for gear 2.
        h2 - highest speed limit for gear 2.
        l3 - lowest speed limit for gear 3.
        h3 - highest speed limit for gear 3.
        l4 - lowest speed limit for gear 4.
        h4 - highest speed limit for gear 4.
        l5 - lowest speed limit for gear 5.
        h5 - highest speed limit for gear 5.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any Illegal argument exception is thrown by checkArgumentsConstraint method.

      • increaseSpeed

        public ManualTransmission increaseSpeed()
        This method increases the speed of the vehicle if and only if the new speed is within the range of maximum allowable speed for the current gear x(less than or equal to lx or greater than or equal to hx). Depending upon the current speed and gear value and how much the driver presses the gas pedal to increase the speed, there can be the following cases:
        • Case 1: OK Speed is successfully increased with no change of gear. Status message is updated as "OK. everything is OK."
        • Case 2: OK_INCREASE_GEAR Speed is increased successfully but the gear can also be increased. Status message is updated as "OK: you may increase the gear."
        • Case 3: ERROR_INCREASING_SPEED_INCREASE_GEAR Speed cannot be increased as it has already reached the highest value for that gear. Status message is updated as "Cannot increase speed, increase gear first."
        • Case 4: ERROR_INCREASING_SPEED_MAX_SPEED Speed cannot be increased as it has already reached the highest value for the maximum gear. Status message is updated as "Cannot increase speed. Reached maximum speed."
        Specified by:
        increaseSpeed in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        transmission object of type ManualTransmission which contains current transmission details.

      • decreaseSpeed

        public ManualTransmission decreaseSpeed()
        This method decreases the speed of the vehicle if and only if the new speed is within the range of minimum allowable speed for the current gear x(less than or equal to lx or greater than or equal to hx). Depending upon the current speed and gear value and how much the driver releases the gas pedal to decrease the speed, there can be the following cases:
        • Case 1: OK Speed is successfully decreased with no change of gear. Status message is updated as "OK. everything is OK."
        • Case 2: OK_DECREASE_GEAR Speed is decreased successfully but the gear can also be decreased. Status message is updated as "OK: you may decrease the gear."
        • Case 3: ERROR_DECREASING_SPEED_DECREASE_GEAR Speed cannot be decreased as it has already reached the minimum value for that gear. Status message is updated as "Cannot decrease speed, decrease gear first."
        • Case 4: ERROR_DECREASING_SPEED_MIN_SPEED Speed cannot be decreased further as it has already reached the minimum value for the first gear which is 0. Status message is updated as "Cannot decrease speed. Reached minimum speed."
        Specified by:
        decreaseSpeed in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        transmission object of type ManualTransmission which contains current transmission * details.

      • increaseGear

        public ManualTransmission increaseGear()
        Increases gear when the gear value is less than the maximum gear and the current speed is allowed to be in the next gear range.
        Specified by:
        increaseGear in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        ManualTransmission object containing current value of gear.

      • decreaseGear

        public ManualTransmission decreaseGear()
        Decreases gear only when the value is greater than minimum gear value and the current speed is allowed to be in the previous gear range.
        Specified by:
        decreaseGear in interface ManualTransmission
        Returns:
        ManualTransmission object containing current value of gear.
